column4: Fitch Expects to Withdraw Priory's Ratings on Acadia Acquisition

(Acadia)  a US-based provider of  inpatient behavioural healthcare services. F

column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. Court of Federal Claims will hear arguments on Jan. 20 in Lockheed Martin Corp's motion to halt Oshkosh Corp's  work on 17 000 armored Humvee truck replacements for the U.S. Army while Lockheed challenges the $6.75 billion contract.

column4: UPDATE 2-Pimco Total Return posts December inflow on reinvestments
column5: NEW YORK  Jan 5 Pacific Investment Management Co's flagship fund posted an inflow of $1.3 billion in December on clients' reinvestments of capital gains  the Newport Beach  California-based firm said on Tuesday.

column4: Pimco Total Return Fund posts $1.3 bln inflow in December
column5: NEW YORK  Jan 5 Pacific Investment Management Co's flagship fund posted an inflow of $1.3 billion in December  according to the Newport Beach  California firm's website on Tuesday.

column4: Poor sales prompt Sanofi to pull plug on Mannkind inhaled insulin
column5: LONDON French drugmaker Sanofi is to stop selling an inhalable insulin developed by Mannkind  following disappointing sales of the product since its launch in February 2015.

column4: UPDATE 2-Poor sales prompt Sanofi to pull plug on Mannkind inhaled insulin
column5: * Mannkind shares slump 40 percent   (Adds analysts' comment  further share price fall)

column4: UPDATE 1-U.S. airlines raise fares $3 in first sector-wide hike since June
column5: NEW YORK  Jan 5 The top U.S. airlines said Tuesday that they have raised fares in the first industry-wide hike since June  moves that may offset increasing labor costs but draw the ire of customers.

column4: Major U.S. airlines up fares in sign of first sector-wide hike since June
column5: Jan 5 Three of the largest U.S. airlines have inched up fares in what could mark the first industry-wide hike since June.

column4: Shares of gun makers soar as Obama tightens firearm rules
column5: Jan 5 Shares of gun manufacturers soared again on Tuesday after President Barack Obama unveiled gun control measures and Smith & Wesson Holding Corp released a more bullish financial outlook.

column4: Deals of the day- Mergers and acquisitions
column5: Jan 5 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2115 GMT on Tuesday:

column4: Canadian Oil Sands investor urges shareholders reject Suncor bid
column5: CALGARY  Alberta A major Canadian Oil Sands Ltd investor sent an open letter to fellow shareholders on Tuesday urging them to reject a C$4.3 billion ($3.1 billion) hostile takeover bid by Suncor Energy Inc that expires this Friday.

column4: India's top court upholds ban on sale of large diesel cars in Delhi
column5: MUMBAI India's top court on Tuesday upheld a temporary ban on the sale of large diesel cars in New Delhi to combat toxic smog in India's capital  but postponed hearing an industry appeal on an environmental tax that carmakers say will hit investment.

column4: Toyota's new R&D company hires technical team
column5: Japanese automaker Toyota Motor Corp's research and development company  Toyota Research Institute (TRI)  said it hired a team of scientists and engineers to help drive research into artificial intelligence and robots.

column4: UPDATE 6-U.S. auto sales in 2015 set record after strong December
column5: DETROIT  Jan 5 Automakers on Tuesday set a new U.S. sales record for 2015 even as December sales fell short of expectations  and most forecasters said sales should rise to another record this year.

column4: Toyota's new R&D company hires technical team

column4: UPDATE 1-Automakers  not Silicon Valley  lead in driverless car patents - study
column5: LAS VEGAS  Jan 5 Automakers  not technology companies  are in the driver's seat in developing self-driving  "autonomous" cars  and Japan's Toyota Motor Corp is best positioned to lead the way  according to a new report on patents for the fast-evolving technology.

column4: UPDATE 1-Toyota undershoots expectations with 2.7 pct China growth target in 2016
column5: BEIJING  Jan 5 Toyota Motor Corp and its joint venture partners aim to sell 1.15 million vehicles in China this year  undershooting overall expectations for the world's largest auto market.

column4: Twitter considering 10 000-character limit for tweets - report
column5: Twitter Inc  is building a new feature that will allow users to post tweets as long as 10 000 characters  well beyond its current 140-character limit  technology news website Re/code reported on Tuesday.

column4: GM invests $500 million in Lyft  sets out self-driving car partnership

column4: Ackman's Pershing Square ends 2015 with 20.5 pct drop
column5: BOSTON Billionaire investor William Ackman's Pershing Square Holdings hedge fund ended 2015 with a 20.5 percent loss after Valeant Pharmaceuticals   a top holding  was battered in the second half of the year.

column4: Ackman's Pershing Square Holdings ends 2015 down 20.5 pct

column4: Exclusive: Verizon launches auction to sell data centers - sources
column5: Verizon Communications Inc  has started a process to sell its data center assets  hoping to fetch more than $2.5 billion  people familiar with the matter said on Tuesday  as the U.S. telecommunications conglomerate focuses on its core business.

column4: Wal-Mart supplier recalls 90 000 lbs of potentially contaminated meat
column5: A supplier to Wal-Mart Stores Inc  the world's largest retailer  has recalled about 90 000 pounds of beef products that may be "contaminated with extraneous wood materials"  the U.S. Agriculture Department said in a release on its website.
